msDesc.head: Saints’ lives and legends. Germany, s. xiv2/4.

msItem.note: This description is abbreviated from Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue (Oxford, 2018), pp. 746–771. For purposes of scholarly citation, reference to the printed catalogue is requested.

msItem.title: Lives of Saints
msItem.note: Several texts represent Bartholomew of Trent, Liber epilogorum in Gesta sanctorum (= Lib. epil.), others from Jacobus de Voragine, Legenda aurea (= LA) (ed.: E. Paoli, Edizione nazionale dei testi mediolatini 2, serie I, i (Florence, 2001); A. Poncelet, ‘Le légendier de Pierre Calo’, AB 29 (1910) 5–116, at pp. 14–19; Welter, L’exemplum, 159f.; Kaeppeli 471 & 2154; A. Dondaine, ‘Barthélemy de Trente O.P.’, AFP 45 (1975) 79–105; BHL nov. suppl. 9033; G. P. Maggioni, ‘Aspetti originali della “Legenda aurea” di Iacopo da Varazze’, Medioevo e Rinascimento 4/ n. s. 1 (Spoleto, 1990) 143–201). For full details, see printed catalogue.

msItem.title: Ortus salvatoris
msItem.note: Petrus Comestor, Historia scholastica: Historia evangelica, 1–6 (ed.: PL 198. 1537B–41B)

msItem.title: Innocentes martyres
msItem.note: Petrus Comestor, Historia scholastica: Historia evangelica, 10, 11 & 23 (ed.: PL 198. 1543A–44A & 1549C), text in part different, end not in ed. ’

msItem.title: Silvester
msItem.bibl: (incipit cf. BHL 7726 & AB 29 (1910) 52: Legendary of Pierre Calo, no. 55)

msItem.title: Epiphania dni
msItem.note: Petrus Comestor, Historia scholastica: Historia evangelica, 7 & 8 (ed.: PL 198. 1541C–42C), text may vary

msItem.title: Marius etc.
msItem.note: Incipit cf. Lib. epil. 39, Acta SS. Ian. II (1643) 216 and Mombritius 2. 241 (BHL 5543)

msItem.title: Purificatio BMV
msItem.note: Cf. Petrus Comestor, Historia scholastica: Historia evangelica, 9 (ed.: PL 198. 1542C–D), the present text considerably longer.

msItem.title: Scholastica
msItem.note: Text in parts identical with LA app. 196 (193) 885–886, l. 8

msItem.title: Benedictus ab. Casinensis
msItem.note: Lib. epil. 80, text in part slightly different.

msItem.title: Sabbatum post dncam 1 in passione dni
Dnca 2 in passione dni (Dnca in palmis)
Waldburgis.
msItem.note: The text is edited as ‘De sanctis Willebaldo e Wunnebaldo’ (no. 60) in D. Gobbi (ed.), Bibliotheca Civis 3 (Trento, 1990) 184f. (after Klosterneuburg, Stiftsbibl., CCl 1236, fols 104v–105r), but is not in Paoli’s edition ( BHL nov. suppl. e; AB 52 (1934) 238 (no. 30)); incipit cf. also BHL 8772.

msItem.title: Inventio s. crucis
msItem.note: (incipit see Acta SS. Maii I (1680) 363A & 445D = Mombritius 1. 376 (BHL 4169))

msItem.title: Barnabas
msItem.note: (incipit see BHL 983; cf. the text printed in Bibliotheca Casinensis 3. 354–57)

msItem.title: Acacius primicerius et soc. 10000 (Decem milia martyrum).
Iohannes Baptista
msItem.note: [Honorius Augustodunensis, Speculum ecclesiae:] De s. Iohanne Baptista (ed.: PL 172. 967A–68A), text may vary, end different.

msItem.title: Petrus et Paulus
msItem.note: A summary of the Passio s. apostolorum Petri et Pauli (ed. R. A. Lipsius, Acta apostolorum apocrypha, vol. 1 (Leipzig, 1891) 119–77 (= Ps.-Marcellus, De actibus apostolorum Petri et Pauli); – Stegmüller, RB, 251,3)

msItem.title: Petrus ap.
msItem.note: Cf. Honorius Augustodunensis, Speculum ecclesiae: De ss. Petro et Paulo (ed.: PL 172. 969D–74A)

msItem.title: Udalricus ep. Augustanus
msItem.note: (W. Wolf, Von der Ulrichsvita zur Ulrichslegende. Untersuchungen zur Überlieferung und Wandlung der Vita Udalrici als Beitrag zu einer Gattungsbestimmung der Legende, PhD diss. (Munich, 1967) 47 & 96 (quoting MS. Prague, Národní knihovna, III G 5, fols 117va–118ra); incipit cf. also BHL 8362–65).

msItem.title: Divisio apostolorum.
msItem.note: Lib. epil. 232; incipit see also AB 29 (1910) 80: Legendary of Pierre Calo, no. 477.

msItem.title: In octava apostolorum Petri et Pauli
Apollinaris ep. Ravennas
msItem.note: (incipit cf. Acta SS. Iul. V (1727) 344F and Mombritius 1. 117 (BHL 623))

msItem.title: Christophorus m. in Lycia
msItem.note: (similar to Mombritius 1. 364–367, l. 25 (BHL 1767); cf. also Acta SS. Iul. VI (1729) 146E (BHL 1766))

msItem.title: Martha v. hospita Christi
msItem.note: Incipit cf. [Ps.-Marcilia], Vita s. Marthae hospitae Christi (ed.: Mombritius 2. 231; – BHL 5545/5547)

msItem.title: Simplicius, Faustinus et Beatrix
msItem.note: (cf. Acta SS. Iul. VII (1731) 36C–E = Mombritius 2. 531f. ( BHL 7790)).

msItem.title: Hippolytus
msItem.note: Lib. epil. 267; incipit cf. also LA 114. 5ff.

msItem.title: Bartholomaeus ap
msItem.note: (incipit cf. Acta SS. Aug. V (1741) 34C and Mombritius 1. 140 (BHL 1002))

msItem.title: Gorgonius et Dorotheus
msItem.note: LA 129, text may vary, end different.

msItem.title: Matthaeus ap.
msItem.bibl: (incipit see Mombritius 2. 257, ll. 42ff. (BHL 5690) and Acta SS. Sept. VI (1757) 221C (BHL 5691); and cf. Stegmüller, RB, 225,17).

msItem.title: Cosmas et Damianus
msItem.note: (incipit cf. Acta SS. Sept. VII (1760) 474F ( BHL 1970); cf. also BHL 1974).

msItem.title: Gallus ab. in Alamannia
msItem.note: Lib. epil. 325; incipit see also AB 102 (1984) 188.

msItem.title: Lucas ev.
msItem.note: Lib. epil. 327; incipit cf. also LA 152. 1 & 11 (BHL 4977).

msItem.title: Simon et Iudas (Thaddaeus)
msItem.note: (incipit see Mombritius 2. 534 (BHL 7749/7750 & BHL nov. suppl. 7750a), and cf. Stegmüller, RB, 255,15).

msItem.title: Severus ep. Ravennas
msItem.note: (ed.: Acta SS. Feb. II (1658) 89A–F (BHL 7682; cf. also BHL nov. suppl. 7681c); incipit see also AB 102 (1984) 373).

msItem.title: Martinus ep. Turonensis
msItem.note: Incipit cf. [Sulpicius Severus, Vita s. Martini] (ed. J. Fontaine, SChr 133 (1967; repr. 2004, with add. and corr.) 254; – BHL 5610, etc.; CPL 475), Lib. epil. 341. 1ff., LA 162. 8f. (BHL p. 827, s. v. Martinus ep. Turonensis, 10. Epitomae) and also Mombritius 2. 196, ll. 36ff. (BHL 5610).

msItem.title: Corbinianus
msItem.note: (incipit cf. BHL 1947 (Arbeo of Freisung, Vita s. Corbiniani, ed. B. Krusch, MGH Script. rer. Mer. 6 (Hanover & Leipzig, 1913) 561) & 1948 (revised version, ed.: Acta SS. Sept. III (1750) 281B)).

msItem.title: Dominicus fundator Ord. Praed.
msItem.note: Lib. epil. 257. 1–184; Acta SS, Aug. I (1733) 559E–61E (BHL 2214)

msItem.title: Translatio s. dominici.
msItem.note: Lib. epil. 177; see also Acta SS, loc. cit., 526B–D (BHL 2215).

msItem.title: Marcellinus presb.
msItem.note: Lib. epil. 149; cf. also LA 58 (BHL p. 777, s. v. Marcellinus presb., 3. Epitomae).

msItem.title: Dies Rogationum.
msItem.note: Incipit (with prothema Lc 11:5) see [Lucas de Bitonto, Sermo in Litaniis maioribus et minoribus] (Schneyer 4. 57. 107).

msItem.title: Thecla
msItem.note: Lib. epil. 306; see also LA app. 208 (204) (BHL p. 1162, s. v. Thecla, 6. Epitomae), text in part different, and expanded; and BHL nov. suppl. 8024e.

msItem.title: Dorothea v. et Theophilus scholasticus
msItem.note: LA app. 210 (207) (BHL 2324), text may vary, end different.

msItem.title: Bernardus ab. Clarevallensis.
msItem.note: Lib. epil. 274. 1–130, text shortened; incipit cf. also AB 102 (1984) 171.

msItem.title: Patricius
msItem.note: Lib. epil. 77; see also Mombritius 2. 343, ll. 1–17 and LA 49. 1–9 (BHL 6514); incipit cf. AB 102 (1984) 367.

msItem.title: Lucia v. m. Syracusis
msItem.note: Lib. epil. 13; incipit cf. also LA 4. 5.

msItem.title: Thomas ap.
msItem.bibl: (incipit see Mombritius 2. 606, ll. 13ff. (BHL 8136 & 8141; Stegmüller, RB, 259,8 & 260,3); cf. also LA 5. 12ff.).

msItem.title: Ortus Pylati
msItem.note: (cf. BHL nov. suppl. 4222d (ed. D. Werner, Pylatus. Untersuchungen zur metrischen lateinischen Pilatuslegende und kritische Textausgabe, Beihefte zum „Mittellateinischen Jahrbuch“ 8 (Ratingen, etc., 1972) 261–68, l. 10)).

msItem.title: Matthias ap.
msItem.note: LA 45. 13–73 (BHL 5717), text may vary; incipit see also AB 29 (1910) 61: Legendary of Pierre Calo, no. 187.

supportDesc.support: parchment; with medieval repair, sometimes remnants thereof (stitching holes). (fol. 123) Bookmark: a parchment strip, glued to both sides of the lower outer margin, indicating the beginning of the life of St Martin.
supportDesc.foliation: i, 1–166, in modern (19th-cent.) pencil. Medieval foliation on fols 1r–165r, in roman numerals, in the upper left- hand side of the right column, supplied by a hand of s. xv from the Mainz Charterhouse.

layoutDesc.layout:
Ruling in ink, two columns of c.32–36. Ruled space
c.190–202 c.124–34

handDesc.handNote: German textualis of an individual stamp, s. xiv2/4, by a single hand. Several corrections and marginalia, including in a hand from Mainz Charterhouse, s. xv (fols 51r, 54r, 132r & 136ra-rb), which is also responsible for the foliation.

binding.p: Brown tanned calf over laminated pulpboard for Abp. Laud, 1637–1639.

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: the 15th-cent. ex-libris inscriptions at the head of fol. 1r and, in the same hand, at the lower margin of fol. 165v: ‘Iste liber est Carthusiensium prope Magunciam(.)’.

William Laud, 1573–1645: The present book consists of seven fascicles, which were likely put together only in the course of the Laudian binding. Ex-libris inscription, dated 1638, at the lower margin of fol. 1r.
history.acquisition: Given to the Bodleian as part of his third donation, dispatched on 28 June 1639.

recordHist.source: See above. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, col. 195 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 36

listBibl.head: Published descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue, 2 vols. (Oxford, 2018), pp. 746–771

revisionDesc.change: Description revised for Mainz digitization project to include additional information from Mairhofer catalogue.
